metadata.title: CVE-2016-9114 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
There is a NULL Pointer Access in function imagetopnm ofconvert.c:1943(jp2) of OpenJPEG 2.1.2. image->comps[compno].data is notassigned a value after initialization(NULL). Impact is Denial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9114` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
